result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Lee Isom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Statement made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay costs, surcharges, assessments and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due on or before 05-07-2015. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

As a convicted Felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defense counsel unavailable to appear this date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court not in session on 3-28-14, case rescheduled to 4-22-14, 8:30 for sentencing.  Attorney Carpenter notified in person.  alp

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  William M. Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Danielle Chojnacki for William M. Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances.
$100.00 cash bail previously posted to remain posted.  The remainer may be returned to person who posted.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-7-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
